minute.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a unit for measuring time. There are 60 minutes in one hour
minute.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: It takes me ten minutes to walk to work.
The train arrived at four minutes past eight.
He returned a few minutes later.
I’ll meet you at the car in five minutes.
minute.translation[0].definitions[1].def: one of the 60 parts into which a degree of an angle is divided. It can be shown as a symbol after a number. For example, 78° 52' means 78 degrees 52 minutes.
minute.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: You only need a minute amount.
minute.translation[1].definitions[1].def: paying careful attention to the smallest details
minute.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: a minute examination of the rock
He explained the plan in minute detail.
minute.translation[2].definitions[0].def: to make an official note of something in the record of a meeting
minute.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: This discussion is off the record and should not be minuted.
minute.translation[3].definitions[0].def: an official written record of what is said and decided at a meeting
minute.translation[3].definitions[0].exa: The minutes of the last AGM were read.
Will someone take the minutes?  (=write down what is said)
minute.translation[3].definitions[1].def: a short official note that gives authority for something or that records a decision
minute.translation[3].definitions[1].exa: We attach a certified copy of a Board minute authorising the signature of this letter.
minute.translation[4].definitions[0].def: to make a written record of something in the minutes of a meeting
minute.translation[4].definitions[0].exa: The board’s decision was formally minuted.
